info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued May 16 at 5:53PM CDT until May 16 at 6:45PM CDT by NWS Lincoln IL
info.description:
The National Weather Service in Lincoln has issued a
* Dust Storm Warning for... Southeastern Marshall County in central Illinois... Northeastern Woodford County in central Illinois...
* Until 645 PM CDT.
* At 552 PM CDT, blowing dust channels across portions of central and east-central Illinois were reducing visibility to near zero.
HAZARD...Near zero visibility with strong wind in excess of 50 mph.
SOURCE...Satellite.
IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel.
* This includes Interstate 39 between mile markers 29 and 40.
Locations impacted include... Toluca and Wenona.
info.instruction:
Motorists should not drive into a dust storm. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
There is no safe place on a highway when a dust storm hits. Visibility can be lost immediately, making it difficult or impossible to slow down and avoid stopped vehicles. Delay travel, or safely exit the highway before the dust storm arrives.

parameter.value: NWS: DUST STORM WARNING til 6:45 PM CDT. Be ready for a sudden drop to zero visibility.

National Weather Service: DUST STORM WARNING for this area until 6:45 PM CDT. Be ready for sudden drop to zero visibility. Pull Aside, Stay Alive! When visibility drops, pull far off the road and put your vehicle in park. Turn the lights off and keep your foot off the brake. Infants, the elderly and those with respiratory issues urged to take precautions.

parameter.value: SNM: AVISO DE TORMENTA DE POLVO hasta las 6:45 PM CDT. Espere reduccion de visibilidad.

AVISO DE TORMENTA DE POLVO hasta las 6:45 PM CDT. Estar alerta para una reduccion repentina en visibilidad. Cuando la visibilidad disminuya, mueva su vehiculo fuera de la carretera. Apague las luces y mantenga su pie fuera del freno. Se recomienda enfaticamente el tomar precauciones para los infantes, ancianos y personas con problemas respiratorios.
